flawed_nl_solution:
If Beatrix has 30 books, Alannah has 30 books + 20 books = <<30+20=50>>50 books.
Queen has 1/5 * 50 books = <<1/5*50=250/1>>250/1 more books than Alannah.
The total number of books Queen has is 50 books + 250/1 books = <<50+250/1=300>>300 books.
All three have 300 books + 50 books + 30 books = <<300+50+30=380>>380 books together
#### 380

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 10, not 250/1. It appears the value was multiplied by the reciprocal of the intended fraction.
